intro: Anthistiria cimicina, commonly known as the Cimicina thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and purple to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits called cypsela, which are typically dispersed by wind. Anthistiria cimicina is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
